titleStmt.title: Robert Thorne, Nicholas Thorne and John Goodriche vs. George Croft, master of St. Bartholomew's Hospital, Bristol. Common recovery. Common Pleas, Easter term, 1532

msIdentifier.msName: Court of Common Pleas: Plea Rolls

div.p:
[H]enricus Octauus Dei Gratia Anglie> et Francie Rex fidei defensor Dominus Hibernie Omnibus ad quos presentes littere peruenerint quod Robertus Thorne Nicholaus Thorne et Johannes Goderiche clericus in curia nostra coram justiciariis nostris apud Westmonasterium ?implcitanerunt
Robertus Thorne Nicholaus Thorne et Johannes Goderiche clericus per Thomam Hymerford attornatum suum
petunt versus Georgium Crofte clericum magistrum hospitalis sive domus sancti Bartholomei ville Bristollie quadraginta
mesuagia triginta gardina decem acras terre sex acras prati viginti acras pasture &et quadraginta
solidatas redditus cum pertinentiis in Villa Bristollie ac in parochiijs sancti Augustini sancti Michaelis sancti Jacobi &et sancti
Philippi in suburbijs ville predicte ut ius &et hereditatem suam Et in que idem Georgius non habet ingressum
nisi post disseisinam quam Henricus Hunt inde iniuste &et sine iudicio fecit prefatis Roberto Nicholao &et Johanni post
primam &cet ccetera
Et predictus Georgius per Johannem Reymond attornatum suum venit Et alias vocat inde ad Warantum Thomam West
militem domini La Warre qui modo per summonitionem ei in comitatu predicto factam per Ricardum Sythemore attornatum suum
similiter venit Et gratis tenementa predicta cum pertinentiis ei Warantizat &cet ccetera Et super hoc predicti Robertus Nicholaus et Johannes
petunt versus ipsum Thomam tenentem per Warantiam suam tenementa predicta cum pertinenciis in forma predicta &cet ccetera Et unde
dicunt quod ipsimet fuerunt seisati de tenementis predictis cum pertinentiis in dominico suo ut de feodo &cet iure tempore
pacis tempore domini Regis nunc capiendo inde explecias ad valenciam &cet ccetera Et in quo &cet ccetera Et inde producunt
sectam &cet ccetera
Et predictus Thomas tenens per warantiam suam defendit ius suum quando &cet ccetera Et ulterius vocat inde ad warantum
Thomam Chapman qui presens est hic in curia in propria persona sua Et gratis tenementa predicta cum pertinentiis
ei warantat &cet ccetera Et supra hoc predicti Robertus Nicholaus et Johannes petunt versus ipsum Thomam Chapman tenentem
per warantiam suam tenementa predicta cum pertinentiis in forma predicta &cet ccetera Et unde dicunt quod ipsimet fuerunt seisati de tenementis
predictis cum pertinentiis in dominico suo ut de feodo et iure tempore pacis tempore domini Regis nunc capiendo
inde explecias ad valenciam &cet ccetera Et in que &cet ccetera Et inde producunt sectam &cet ccetera
Et predictus Thomas Chapman tenens per warantiam suam defendit ius suum quando &cet ccetera Et dicit quod predictus
Henricus non disseisivit prefatos Robertum Nicholaum &cet Johannem de tenementis predictis cum pertinentiis prout ijdem Robertus Nicholaus
et Johannes per breve et narracionem sua predicta superius supponunt Et de hoc ponit se supra patriam &cet ccetera
Et predicti Robertus Nicholaus et Johannes petunt licentiam inde interloquendi Et habent &cet ccetera Et postea ijdem
Robertus Nicholaus et Johannes reveniunt hic in curiam isto eodem termino per attornatum suum predictum Et predictus Thomas
Chapman licet solempniter exactus non revenit set in contemptum curie recessit et defaltam facit
Ideo consideratum est quod predicti Robertus Nicholaus et Johannes recuperent seisinam suam versus prefatum Georgium de
tenementis predictis cum pertinentiis Et quod idem Georgius habeat de terra predicti Thome West ad valenciam &c et ccetera
Et quod idem Thomas ulterius habeat de terra predicti Thome Chapman ad valenciam &cet ccetera Et idem
Thomas in misericordia &cet ccetera Et supra hoc predicti Robertus Nicholaus et Johannes petunt breve domini Regis vicecomiti comitatus predicti dirigendum
de habere faciendo eis plenariam seisinam de tenementis predictis cum pertinentiis Et eis conceditur retornabile hic in crastino ascencionis
domini &cet ccetera Ad quem diem hic venunt predicti Robertus Nicholaus et Johannes per attornatum suum predictum et vicecomes videlicet Willelmus Cary et Johannes
Mauncell modo mandat quod ipse virtute brevis illius tercio die May regni domini Regis nunc vicesimo quarto habere fecit
eisdem Roberto Nicholao et Johanni plenarium seisinam de tenementis predictis cum pertinentiis prout per breve illud sibi perceptum fuit &cet ccetera
Robertus Thorne Nicholaus Thorne et Johannes Goderiche clericus per Thomam Hymerford attornatum suum petunt
versus Georgium Crofte clericum magistrum hospitalis sive domus sancti Bartholomei ville Bristollie sex mesuagia
trescentas acras terre octoginta acras prati ducentas acras pasture decem acras bosci &et quadraginta
solidatas redditus cum pertinentiis in Kyngesmarshe ac in parochijs de Clyfton Wyk Warr Stapulton Over
Horfild &et Sodbury ut ius &et hereditatem suam Et in que idem Georgius non habet ingressum nisi post
disseisinam quam Henricus Hunt inde iniuste &et sine iudicio fecit prefatis Roberto Nicholao &et Johanni post primam &cet ccetera
Et predictus Georgius per Johannem Reymond attornatum suum venit Et alias vocat inde ad Warantum Thomam West
militem domini La Warre qui modo per summonitionem ei in comitatu predicto factam per Ricardum Sythemore attornatum suum similiter
venit Et gratis tenementa predicta cum pertinentiis ei Warantizat &cet ccetera Et super hoc predicti Robertus Nicholaus et Johannes petunt versus
ipsum Thomam tenentem per Warantiam suam tenementa predicta cum pertinenciis in forma predicta &cet ccetera Et unde dicunt quod ipsimet
fuerunt seisati de tenementis predictis cum pertinentiis in dominico suo ut de feodo &cet iure tempore pacis tempore domini
Regis nunc capiendo inde explecias ad valenciam &cet ccetera Et in quo &cet ccetera Et inde producunt sectam &cet ccetera
Et predictus Thomas tenens per warantiam suam defendit ius suum quando &cet ccetera Et ulterius vocat inde ad warantum
Thomam Chapman qui presens est hic in curia in propria persona sua Et gratis tenementa predicta cum pertinentiis
ei warantat &cet ccetera Et supra hoc predicti Robertus Nicholaus et Johannes petunt versus ipsum Thomam Chapman tenentem
per warantiam suam tenementa predicta cum pertinentiis in forma predicta &cet ccetera Et unde dicunt quod ipsimet fuerunt seisati de
tenementis predictis cum pertinentiis in dominico suo ut de feodo et iure tempore pacis tempore domini Regis nunc
capiendo inde explecias ad valenciam &cet ccetera Et in que &cet ccetera Et inde producunt sectam &cet ccetera
Et predictus Thomas Chapman tenens per warantiam suam defendit ius suum quando &cet ccetera Et dicit quod predictus
Henricus non disseisivit prefatos Robertum Nicholaum &cet Johannem de tenementis predictis cum pertinentiis prout ijdem Robertus Nicholaus
et Johannes per breve et narracionem sua predicta superius supponunt Et de hoc ponit se supra patriam &cet ccetera
Et predicti Robertus Nicholaus et Johannes petunt licentiam inde interloquendi Et habent &cet ccetera Et postea ijdem Robertus
Nicholaus et Johannes reveniunt hic in curiam isto eodem termino per attornatum suum predictum Et predictus Thomas
Chapman licet solempniter exactus non revenit set in contemptum curie recessit et defaltam facit Ideo
consideratum est quod predicti Robertus Nicholaus et Johannes recuperent seisinam suam versus prefatum Georgium de tenementis
predictis cum pertinentiis Et quod idem Georgius habeat de terra predicti Thome West ad valenciam &c et ccetera Et quod idem
Thomas ulterius habeat de terra predicti Thome Chapman ad valenciam &cet ccetera Et idem Thomas in misericordia &cet ccetera
Et supra hoc predicti Robertus Nicholaus et Johannes petunt breve domini Regis vicecomiti comitatus predicti dirigendum de habere faciendo eis plenariam seisinam de
tenementis predictis cum pertinentiis Et eis conceditur retornabile hic in crastino ascencionis domini &cet ccetera Ad quem diem hic venunt predicti Robertus Nicholaus
et Johannes per attornatum suum predictum et vicecomes videlicet Edwardud Wadham miles modo mandat quod ipse virtute brevis illius tercio die May
regni domini Regis nunc vicesimo quarto habere fecit eisdem Roberto Nicholao et Johanni plenarium seisinam de tenementis predictis cum pertinentiis prout
per breve illud sibi perceptum fuit &cet ccetera

Henry the Eighth by the grace of God King of England and France defender of the faith and lord of Ireland. To all to whom the present letters shall come, greetings.
Robert Thorne, Nicholas Thorne, George Goodriche, clerk, by their attorney Thomas Hymerford claim against George Croft, clerk, master of the hospital or house of Saint Bartholomew of the town of Bristol, six messuages, three hundred acres of land, eighty acres of meadow, two hundred acres of pasture, ten acres of wood and forty shillings of rent with appurtenances in Kingsmarsh and in the parishes of Clifton, Wickwarr, Stapulton over Horfield and Sodbury as their right and inheritance. And into which the same George has no entry except after disseisin which Henry Hunt unjustly and without judgement has made thereof to the aforesaid Robert, Nicholas and John after the first etc. And the aforesaid George by John Reymond his attorney comes and otherwise vouches thereof to warrant Thomas West, knight, Lord de la Warr, who now by summons made to him in the aforesaid county similarly comes by Richard Sythemore his attorney, and freely warrants to him the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances etc. And hereupon the aforesaid Robert, Nicholas and John claim against the said Thomas, tenant by his warranty, the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances in the aforesaid form etc. And whereupon they say that they themselves have been seised of the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances in their demense as of fee and right in the time of peace of the present Lord King by taking the profits thereof to the value etc. And into which etc. And thereupon they bring suit etc. And the aforesaid Thomas, tenant, by his own warranty defends his right when etc. And furthermore vouches thereof to warrant Thomas Chapman who is present here in court in his own person, and freely warrants to him the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances etc. And hereupon the aforesaid Robert, Nicholas and John claim against the said Thomas Chapman, tenant, by his warranty, to the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances in the aforesaid form etc. And whereupon they say that they themselves have been seised of the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances in their demense as of fee and right in the time of peace of the present Lord King by taking the profits thereof to the value etc. And into which etc. And thereupon they bring suit etc. And the aforesaid Thomas Chapman, tenent, by his warranty defends his right when etc. And says the aforesaid Henry did not disseise the aforesaid Robert, Nicholas, John of the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances, just as the same Robert, Nicholas and John by their aforesaid writ and statement above suppose. And of this he puts himself before the country etc. And the aforesaid Robert, Nicholas and John crave leave to imparl thereupon. And they have it etc. And afterwards the same Robert, Nicholas and John return into court this same term by their aforesaid attorney. And the aforesaid Thomas Chapman although solemnly called does not come but in contempt of the court withdraws and does default. Therefore it is considered that the aforesaid Robert, Nicholas and John recover their seisin against the aforesaid George of the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances. And that the same George has of the land of the aforesaid Thomas West to the value etc. And furthermore that the same Thomas has of the land of the aforesaid Thomas Chapman to the value etc. And the same Thomas in mercy etc. And hereupon the aforesaid Robert, Nicholas and John require the writ of the Lord King to be directed to the sheriffs of the aforesaid county to cause them to have full seisin of the said tenements with appurtenances. And it is granted to them, returnable here on the morning of the Ascension of our Lord etc. At which day came here the aforesaid Robert, Nicholas and John by their aforesaid attorney. And the sheriff, namely Edward Wadham, knight, now return that he by the virtue of that writ of the third day of May the twenty fourth year of the present king did cause the same Robert, Nicholas and John to have full seisin of the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances, as by that writ he was commanded etc.
[Left Margin:] Town of Bristol
Robert Thorne, Nicholas Thorne, George Goodriche, clerk, by their attorney Thomas Hymerford claim against George Croft, clerk, master of the hospital or house of Saint Bartholomew of the town of Bristol, forty messuages, thirty gardens, ten acres of land, six acres of meadow, twenty acres of pasture and forty shillings of rent with appurtenances in the town of Bristoll and in the parishes of St. Augustine, St. Michael, St. James and St. Philip in the suburbs of the aforesaid town as their right and inheritance. And into which the same George has no entry except after disseisin which Henry Hunt unjustly and without judgement has made thereof to the aforesaid Robert, Nicholas and John after the first etc. And the aforesaid George by John Reymond his attorney comes and otherwise vouches thereof to warrant Thomas West, knight, Lord de la Warr, who now by summons made to him in the aforesaid county similarly comes by Richard Sythemore his attorney, and freely warrants to him the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances etc. And hereupon the aforesaid Robert, Nicholas and John claim against the said Thomas, tenant by his warranty, the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances in the aforesaid form etc. And whereupon they say that they themselves have been seised of the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances in their demense as of fee and right in the time of peace of the present Lord King by taking the profits thereof to the value etc. And into which etc. And thereupon they bring suit etc. And the aforesaid Thomas, tenant, by his own warranty defends his right when etc. And furthermore vouches thereof to warrant Thomas Chapman who is present here in court in his own person, and freely warrants to him the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances etc. And hereupon the aforesaid Robert, Nicholas and John claim against the said Thomas Chapman, tenant, by his warranty, to the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances in the aforesaid form etc. And whereupon they say that they themselves have been seised of the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances in their demense as of fee and right in the time of peace of the present Lord King by taking the profits thereof to the value etc. And into which etc. And thereupon they bring suit etc. And the aforesaid Thomas Chapman, tenent, by his warranty defends his right when etc. And says the aforesaid Henry did not disseise the aforesaid Robert, Nicholas, John of the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances, just as the same Robert, Nicholas and John by their aforesaid writ and statement above suppose. And of this he puts himself before the country etc. And the aforesaid Robert, Nicholas and John crave leave to imparl thereupon. And they have it etc. And afterwards the same Robert, Nicholas and John return into court this same term by their aforesaid attorney. And the aforesaid Thomas Chapman although solemnly called does not come but in contempt of the court withdraws and does default. Therefore it is considered that the aforesaid Robert, Nicholas and John recover their seisin against the aforesaid George of the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances. And that the same George has of the land of the aforesaid Thomas West to the value etc. And furthermore that the same Thomas has of the land of the aforesaid Thomas Chapman to the value etc. And the same Thomas in mercy etc. And hereupon the aforesaid Robert, Nicholas and John require the writ of the Lord King to be directed to the sheriffs of the aforesaid county to cause them to have full seisin of the said tenements with appurtenances. And it is granted to them, returnable here on the morning of the Ascension of our Lord etc. At which day came here the aforesaid Robert, Nicholas and John by their aforesaid attorney. And the sheriff, namely William Cary et John Mauncell, now return that he by the virtue of that writ of the third day of May the twenty fourth year of the present king did cause the same Robert, Nicholas and John to have full seisin of the aforesaid tenements with appurtenances, as by that writ he was commanded etc.
